AssociateProfile.name: AssociateProfile
AssociateProfile.documentation: Associates a Route 53 Profiles profile with a VPC. A VPC can have only one Profile associated with it, but a Profile can be associated with 1000 of VPCs (and you can request a higher quota). For more information, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/Route53/latest/DeveloperGuide/DNSLimitations.html#limits-api-entities.

AssociateResourceToProfile.name: AssociateResourceToProfile
AssociateResourceToProfile.documentation: Associates a DNS reource configuration to a Route 53 Profile.

DeleteProfile.name: DeleteProfile
DeleteProfile.documentation: Deletes the specified Route 53 Profile. Before you can delete a profile, you must first disassociate it from all VPCs.

DisassociateProfile.name: DisassociateProfile
DisassociateProfile.documentation: Dissociates a specified Route 53 Profile from the specified VPC.

DisassociateResourceFromProfile.name: DisassociateResourceFromProfile
DisassociateResourceFromProfile.documentation: Dissoaciated a specified resource, from the Route 53 Profile.

GetProfile.name: GetProfile
GetProfile.documentation: Returns information about a specified Route 53 Profile, such as whether whether the Profile is shared, and the current status of the Profile.

GetProfileAssociation.name: GetProfileAssociation
GetProfileAssociation.documentation: Retrieves a Route 53 Profile association for a VPC. A VPC can have only one Profile association, but a Profile can be associated with up to 5000 VPCs.

GetProfileResourceAssociation.name: GetProfileResourceAssociation
GetProfileResourceAssociation.documentation: Returns information about a specified Route 53 Profile resource association.

ListProfileAssociations.name: ListProfileAssociations
ListProfileAssociations.documentation: Lists all the VPCs that the specified Route 53 Profile is associated with.

ListProfileResourceAssociations.name: ListProfileResourceAssociations
ListProfileResourceAssociations.documentation: Lists all the resource associations for the specified Route 53 Profile.

ListProfiles.name: ListProfiles
ListProfiles.documentation: Lists all the Route 53 Profiles associated with your Amazon Web Services account.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Lists the tags that you associated with the specified resource.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Adds one or more tags to a specified resource.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: Removes one or more tags from a specified resource.

UpdateProfileResourceAssociation.name: UpdateProfileResourceAssociation
UpdateProfileResourceAssociation.documentation: Updates the specified Route 53 Profile resourse association.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: The current account doesn't have the IAM permissions required to perform the specified operation.

Tags.documentation: A list of the tag keys and values that you want to identify the Profile association.

ProfileAssociation.documentation: The association that you just created. The association has an ID that you can use to identify it in other requests, like update and delete.

ResourceArn.documentation: Amazon resource number, ARN, of the DNS resource.

ResourceProperties.documentation:
If you are adding a DNS Firewall rule group, include also a priority. The priority indicates the processing order for the rule groups, starting with the priority assinged the lowest value.

The allowed values for priority are between 100 and 9900.

ProfileResourceAssociation.documentation: Infromation about the AssociateResourceToProfile, including a status message.

ConflictException.documentation: The request you submitted conflicts with an existing request.

ClientToken.documentation: ClientToken is an idempotency token that ensures a call to CreateProfile completes only once. You choose the value to pass. For example, an issue might prevent you from getting a response from CreateProfile. In this case, safely retry your call to CreateProfile by using the same CreateProfile parameter value.

Tags.documentation: A list of the tag keys and values that you want to associate with the Route 53 Profile.

Profile.documentation: The Profile that you just created.

ProfileId.documentation: The ID of the Profile that you want to delete.

Profile.documentation: Information about the DeleteProfile request, including the status of the request.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

ProfileResourceAssociation.documentation: Information about the DisassociateResourceFromProfile request, including the status of the request.

ProfileAssociationId.documentation: The identifier of the association you want to get information about.

ProfileAssociation.documentation: Information about the Profile association that you specified in a GetProfileAssociation request.

ProfileResourceAssociationId.documentation: The ID of the profile resource association that you want to get information about.

ProfileResourceAssociation.documentation: Information about the Profile resource association that you specified in a GetProfileResourceAssociation request.

Profile.documentation: Information about the Profile, including the status of the Profile.

InternalServiceErrorException.documentation: An internal server error occured. Retry your request.

FieldName.documentation: The parameter field name for the invalid parameter exception.

InvalidParameterException.documentation: One or more parameters in this request are not valid.

ResourceType.documentation: The resource type that caused the limits to be exceeded.

LimitExceededException.documentation: The request caused one or more limits to be exceeded.

MaxResults.documentation:
The maximum number of objects that you want to return for this request. If more objects are available, in the response, a NextToken value, which you can use in a subsequent call to get the next batch of objects, is provided.

If you don't specify a value for MaxResults, up to 100 objects are returned.

NextToken.documentation:
For the first call to this list request, omit this value.

When you request a list of objects, at most the number of objects specified by MaxResults is returned. If more objects are available for retrieval, a NextToken value is returned in the response. To retrieve the next batch of objects, use the token that was returned for the prior request in your next request.

If more than MaxResults profile associations match the specified criteria, you can submit another ListProfileAssociations request to get the next group of results. In the next request, specify the value of NextToken from the previous response.

ProfileAssociations.documentation: A complex type that containts settings information about the profile's VPC associations.

MaxResults.documentation:
The maximum number of objects that you want to return for this request. If more objects are available, in the response, a NextToken value, which you can use in a subsequent call to get the next batch of objects, is provided.

If you don't specify a value for MaxResults, up to 100 objects are returned.

NextToken.documentation:
For the first call to this list request, omit this value.

When you request a list of objects, at most the number of objects specified by MaxResults is returned. If more objects are available for retrieval, a NextToken value is returned in the response. To retrieve the next batch of objects, use the token that was returned for the prior request in your next request.

ResourceType.documentation: ID of a resource if you want information on only one type.

NextToken.documentation: If more than MaxResults resource associations match the specified criteria, you can submit another ListProfileResourceAssociations request to get the next group of results. In the next request, specify the value of NextToken from the previous response.

ProfileResourceAssociations.documentation: Information about the profile resource association that you specified in a GetProfileResourceAssociation request.

MaxResults.documentation:
The maximum number of objects that you want to return for this request. If more objects are available, in the response, a NextToken value, which you can use in a subsequent call to get the next batch of objects, is provided.

If you don't specify a value for MaxResults, up to 100 objects are returned.

NextToken.documentation:
For the first call to this list request, omit this value.

When you request a list of objects, at most the number of objects specified by MaxResults is returned. If more objects are available for retrieval, a NextToken value is returned in the response. To retrieve the next batch of objects, use the token that was returned for the prior request in your next request.

If more than MaxResults resource associations match the specified criteria, you can submit another ListProfiles request to get the next group of results. In the next request, specify the value of NextToken from the previous response.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the resource that you want to list the tags for.

Tags.documentation: The tags that are associated with the resource that you specified in the ListTagsForResource request.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Profile.

ClientToken.documentation: The ClientToken value that was assigned when the Profile was created.

CreationTime.documentation: The date and time that the Profile was created, in Unix time format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

ModificationTime.documentation: The date and time that the Profile was modified, in Unix time format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

OwnerId.documentation: Amazon Web Services account ID of the Profile owner.

StatusMessage.documentation: Status message that includes additiona information about the Profile.

Profile.documentation: A complex type that includes settings for a Route 53 Profile.

CreationTime.documentation: The date and time that the Profile association was created, in Unix time format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

ModificationTime.documentation: The date and time that the Profile association was modified, in Unix time format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

OwnerId.documentation: Amazon Web Services account ID of the Profile association owner.

ResourceId.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the VPC.

StatusMessage.documentation: Additional information about the Profile association.

ProfileAssociation.documentation: An association between a Route 53 Profile and a VPC.

CreationTime.documentation: The date and time that the Profile resource association was created, in Unix time format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

Id.documentation: ID of the Profile resource association.

ModificationTime.documentation: The date and time that the Profile resource association was modified, in Unix time format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

Name.documentation: Name of the Profile resource association.

OwnerId.documentation: Amazon Web Services account ID of the Profile resource association owner.

ProfileId.documentation: Profile ID of the Profile that the resources are associated with.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource association.

ResourceProperties.documentation: If the DNS resource is a DNS Firewall rule group, this indicates the priority.

ResourceType.documentation: Resource type, such as a private hosted zone, or DNS Firewall rule group.

Status.documentation: Status of the Profile resource association.

StatusMessage.documentation: Additional information about the Profile resource association.

ProfileResourceAssociation.documentation: The association between a Route 53 Profile and resources.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Profile.

ProfileSummary.documentation: Summary information about a Route 53 Profile.

ResourceType.documentation: The resource type that caused the resource exists exception.

ResourceExistsException.documentation: The resource you are trying to associate, has already been associated.

ResourceType.documentation: The resource type that caused the resource not found exception.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: The resource you are associating is not found.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the resource that you want to add tags to.

Tags.documentation: The tags that you want to add to the specified resource.

ThrottlingException.documentation: The request was throttled. Try again in a few minutes.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the resource that you want to remove tags from.

TagKeys.documentation: The tags that you want to remove to the specified resource.

ResourceProperties.documentation:
If you are adding a DNS Firewall rule group, include also a priority. The priority indicates the processing order for the rule groups, starting with the priority assinged the lowest value.

The allowed values for priority are between 100 and 9900.

ProfileResourceAssociation.documentation: Information about the UpdateProfileResourceAssociation request, including a status message.

ValidationException.documentation: You have provided an invalid command.

documentation: With Amazon Route 53 Profiles you can share Route 53 configurations with VPCs and AWS accounts
